channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WINK-7] Need to apply ASL 2.0 header on all applicable files
item.description: Basically, any file that can take a comment should have a standard ASL 2.0 header added to it.
item.summary: Need to apply ASL 2.0 header on all applicable files

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
First round of adding legal headers on muck.

Apply with:

patch -p1 -i WINK-7.patch

The version of patch that I have on this machine doesn't seem to like that command. I get:

C:\work\code\wink-7>patch -p 1 -i WINK-7.patch
Hmm... Looks like an ed script to me...
(Patch is indented 1 space.)
The text leading up to this was:
--------------------------

From 282538c867d5e892d995da6bf61d370e3e6accfd Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Jason Dillon <jason@planet57.com>
Date: Sat, 27 Jun 2009 14:10:01 +0700
Subject: [PATCH] Update legal headers
—
pom.xml 21 ++-
src/assembly/dist.xml 21 ++-
src/site/apt/additional-features.apt 22 ++-
src/site/apt/client.apt 21 ++-
src/site/apt/documentation.apt 21 ++-
src/site/apt/downloads.apt 27 ++-
src/site/apt/examples.apt 21 ++-
src/site/apt/how-to-build.apt 35 +++-
src/site/apt/index.apt 21 ++-
src/site/apt/license.apt 18 ++
src/site/apt/security.apt 21 ++-
src/site/fml/faqs.fml 23 ++-
src/site/site.xml 19 ++
--------------------------
681
?
done

C:\work\code\wink-7>

Trying from my Linux machine to see if that works.

It didn't puke up like this for me, there were some hunk failures though, but easy to sort those out... grrr svn blah:

Bliss:wink-trunk jason$ patch -p1 -i ../patches/WINK-7.patch.txt

Hey Jason, on my Mac I saw some carriage returns ^M in the patch. I'm assuming those are intentional. If so, I can apply this patch I think.

I will re-apply to my local branch and provide a cleaner patch, though my guess is that unless time stands still and no one makes and commits, there will be a few failures by the time a commiter gets around the applying this puppy
Latest WINK-7.patch should apply cleaner on trunk now.
I built the patch from git format-patch on my mac, and then tested patch -p1 -i ... on a svn co of trunk, and it applied just fine. All on a Mac... for anything I do :-P
Thanks for the updated patch. I will apply it from my Mac this morning.
FYI, Bryant, the patch has CR ^M's in it becase many of these files are DOS encoded. We should eventually dos2unix the entire tree.
